product.productDescription: Composition: Trepat 100%.Vinification and ageing: Made from musts produced from carefully selected grapes and vinified at a controlled temperature. Rounded, pleasant in the mouth, with a persistent aftertaste.The Bodega.The Bodega is located in Sant Sadurni d'Anoia, the capital of the DO Cava.Vineyards: Sources grapes from an area of 3,000 hectares which belong to the D.O. Penedès for still wines and to the D.O. Cava for producing cava sparkling wines. These vineyards are mainly made up of Macabeo, Xarel.lo and Parellada vines for white grapes and Garnacha Tinta and Monastrell for red ones.For more details, visit our web site: www.campoviejo.comD.O. CAVA.Location:40 kms South of Barcelona.Surface Area:32,000 hectares.Type of soil:Calcareous, the earth is of average consistency, permeable to water.Climate:Typical Mediterranean climate, bright and sunny, mild winters and summers which are not excessively hot.History.Tradition attributes the famous Benedictine, Dom Pierre Perignon, as the inventor of sparkling wine. But sparkling wines have always existed and have even been produced in small quantities.Nevertheless, Dom Perignon is credited with having carefully studied and improved the technique for making these wines by using his exceptional sense of smell and his particular artistry in wine blending to create a perfectly balanced product.The date 1872 is considered to be the true year in which sparkling wine production began in Catalonia, sparkling wine which would not reach the market until 1880 Sant Sadurni d'Anoia and the surrounding area were the centre of the incipient expanding industry which would in time go on to become the most representative and successful of Catalan viticulture.

The traditional Medieval bandurria was a three stringed instrument similar to the mandolin, primarily used in Spanish folk music

Intense aromas of plums, cherries, hints of strawberries and toasty vanillin oak. Velvety smooth and elegant. The rich aromatic flavours of toasty, spicy oak and dark fruits persist on the palate. Its origins date back to 1959 when two small Rioja wine cellars with a long tradition, Beristain y Ortigüela, joined forces to create Bodegas Campo Viejo. The Juan Alcorta Bodega is built on a plateau planted with vines. It has panoramic views where you can enjoy a glass of Rioja looking out over Ebro Valley and the Sierra de Cantabria mountains. Campo Viejo Crianza is aged in oak casks for 12 months to give it its spicy-vanilla oak flavours. This is followed by 6 months in the bottle to help mature the wine and marry the flavours. The wine now qualifies as a 'Crianza'.

Wine of Spain. The grapes from these old vines have been selected to produce a rich, well structured and concentrated red, full of lively, red berry fruitiness. Casa Carmela (from karmel, meaning vineyard or vines in Hebrew), is how we have known the little farming house overlooking beautiful vineyards in our sun-baked region of Yecla in Eastern Spain. The original two-storey house, made of stone and tiles, was a refuge for the farmers at night time, along with the mules that would have helped in the fields. The house is surrounded by smooth hills that protect this natural garden of vines, olive and almond trees.

From the world's leading rum-maker. Original premium white rum. Bacardi Superior Rum Tasting Notes: Appearance: Clear, polished, shimmering and bright, water white. Aroma/Nose: Impressions of light vanilla, (which serves to bring up the other flavours) and fresh apricot. Crisp woody herbs (lavender, thyme), flowers, subtle fresh fruits, soft nuts (ground almonds/marzipan), light banana. Taste/Palate: Mild, soft, aromatic and delicate. Candied fruit, crystallised fruit, impressions of vanilla and apricot, sweet, creamy almond/marzipan flavours (almond croissant), Sweet fruity overtones, smooth and light. Finish: Dry, crisp and very clean finish, slightly sweet. Bacardi is a true icon. The original spirit in some of the world's most legendary cocktails. Due to Bacardi Superior Rum's perfectly balanced taste it was used by cocktail pioneers as the principle ingredient in the birth of the world's best known rum cocktails including the legendary Mojito (1860s), the Daiquiri (1896)&the Cuba Libre (1900). The UK's no.1 rum continues to refresh and cast a spell on all those who drink it. . Established in 1862 in Santiago de Cuba Bacardi Superior Rum became the world's first premium aged white rum. To produce such a superior spirit Don Facundo Bacardi combined the best of dark spirits production techniques (ageing and blending) with his pioneering filtration process (charcoal filtration) to create the perfectly balanced mixing rum that neither overpowers nor disappears in your drink.

Product of Barbados. International Gold Awards - International Wine&Spirit Competition 1981/4/9 - Gold Medal. Cockspur Fine Rum is an expert blend of superior Bajan rum, matured in oak barrels to mellow the spirit. It is distilled from the best quality island cane molasses and pure spring water emanating from the Barbados limestone aquifer, a smooth water filtered by coral stone. This combination of ageing and blending defines the unique character for which Cockspur is renowned. Barbados is generally regarded as the birthplace of rum and the famous Cockspur brand, with its proud and colourful \u2018rooster\u2019 symbol, has been an integral part of island life since 1884.

Perfected by Tradition. SINCE 1703. The Quintessence of Rum. Widely recognised as the oldest run in the world, MOUNT GAY®RUM has been hand-crafted at the same location in Barbados for more than 300 years using a unique production process to please the palate of connoisseurs the world over.

From the world's leading rum-maker. Bacardi Gold is a light golden rum with a soft oak flavour. It has rich vanilla, buttery caramel, raisin, toasted almond and sweet ripe banana notes balanced with the warm zest of orange peel and a hint of smoke. It has a dry and slightly sweet finish, retaining a subtle background of oak. Bacardi Gold forms the basis of the Cuba Libre , invented in the American Bar, Havana, in 1900; two years after the end of the Cuban-American war. This \u2018cocktail of freedom\u2019 is one of the most popular cocktails in the world today. Bacardi Gold is hand blended by Maestros de Ron Bacardi using rum aged between 1 and 2 years in oak barrels. This gold rum is designed to bring depth and character to classic rum cocktails, whilst still being smooth in its flavour.

Smooth&Spiced Spirit drink of premium rum with flavours&spices straight from the heart of charred oak barrels for a hint of smokiness. Bacardi Oakheart is a tribute to the legendary and modern day adventurer. It honours their core essence and loyalty, bravery and determination. These timeless qualities, backed by over a century of Bacardi tradition, are reflected in the robust taste of Oakheart; smooth&spiced with just a hint of smokiness.
EST. 1849. IMPORTED. RICH HERITAGE. SMOOTH FLAVOUR. Alfred Lamb. THE NAME FOR RUM.

product.productDescription: ""It has an intense and complex aroma, with a palate of honey, vanilla, chocolate, cocoa, sweet tobacco, dry fruits and spicy notes. The finish is powerful and full-bodied"".

In the spirit of the Caribbean. Some say, you can hear the ocean in a seashell. We say, you can feel summer in every bottle of Malibu®. Malibu®Caribbean rum with coconut flavour is perfect for when the sun's setting and the good times are flowing. Thanks to its smooth, fresh taste, that sun-kissed island feeling is only a sip away. Scan the QR code for more drink recipes www.malibu-rum.com

The original Rum. Produce of Jamaica, Guyana and Barbados. The legend of Captain Morgan began over 300 years ago. His infamous career included life as a buccaneer, Admiral of the Fleet and culminated in 1680 with his appointment as Governor General of Jamaica. At that time his interests turned to his sugar cane plantation and the perfection of a rum worthy to bear his name. The rich smooth flavour of Captain Morgan rum is enjoyed by anyone who seeks the true taste of the Caribbean. The superior quality of Captain Morgan is firstly owed to the rum's provenance, as the Captain is a premium blend of five rum marques from three different Caribbean countries, allowing for greater complexity of flavour. Then the rum is distilled partly using the traditional 'pot stilled' process resulting in greater quality and fuller flavour. Finally the rum is aged for at least two years in charred oak barrels before the Ron Maestro (master blender) performs his art in the secret blending of the finished liquid. The resulting rum is one of superior quality&taste. Incredibly rich&smooth, you will taste many flavours including toffee&vanilla, with a rounded oaken nose. Enjoy Captain Morgan with cola or ginger ale, plenty of ice&a twist of lime.

An imported rum with spice, caramel and other natural flavours. The Kraken is imported rum from the Caribbean blended with natural flavor. Named for a sea beast of myth and legend, The Kraken Rum is strong, rich, black and smooth. The Kraken rum company. Producers and shippers of fine rums to points around the world.

Rum of the year - Mundas Vini 2006, Mundas Vini 2005. Double gold medal winner - San Francisco world spirits competition 2011. Gold medal winner - The rum masters 2011. Gold medal winner - San Francisco world spirits competition 2009. Gold medal winner - beverage testing institute of Chicago 2005. Gold medal winner - American beverage institute 2002. 95 rating - wine enthusiast magazine June 2002. Highly recommended - US spirits journal 2002. Finely distilled premium Caribbean rum. The Great Fire of 1932. Opportunity is often embedded in risk. In 1932 a great fire destroyed the Trinidad&Tobago Government Rum Bond. Joseph Bento Fernandes, master blender and owner of Fernandes Distillery, seized this opportunity and bought the charred casks of rum only then to discover that this rum had aged and matured magnificently. This prize rum was skillfully blended and called 1919""Super""Premium Rum (1919 being the year the rum was casked). As expected, this rum was soon ingreat demand. This demand eventually spread overseas through a most interesting set of circumstances. Declaration of War. With the declaration of World War II in 1939, Trinidad&Tobago troops volunteered to serve on the battlefronts in Europe. The Company decided to send a bottle of 1919""Super""Premium Rum on a regular basis to each of our airmen serving overseas. Through their generosity they soon came to share our rum with their foreign colleagues - and thus our product become known in the wider world and our 1919""Super""Premium Rum came to symbolise the spirit of Trinidad&Tobago. Nearly 200 years of our expertise is captured in this blend of aged rums from the unspoilt islands of Trinidad&Tobago. With notes of oak, cocoa and vanilla we believed that you will drink no smoother rum than Angostura 1919.

Welcome to Cuba! Our sugar cane is grown in the most fertile of lands. It gives birth to one of the finest rums in the world: Havana Club. The aguardientes of this""Añejo Especial""are aged in oak barrels, giving it a remarkable aroma and a warm golden glow. You may savour it on the rocks or mixed with cola. A national cocktail from Cuba: the Cuba Libre. Ittakes its name from the battle call of the Cuban independence wars.

Traditional rum made and aged in Cuba. Havana Club Añejo 3 Años is a white rum, smooth and light, aged naturally for 3 years to reveal an intense aroma. Its complex flavour has established it as the ideal rum for cocktails in Cuba such as the Mojito and Daiquiri. Located on a small cobbled street in the beating heart of Havana, La Bodeguita del Medio is one of the world's most legendary bars. This incomparable place has been warmly greeting visitors for decades. Inside, fantastic objects, frames, pictures are piling up in the purest unique style of the Cuban capital. The walls, floor to ceiling, are covered with enthusiastic guests' inscriptions and recount thousands of warm memories. Most of these praise the undisputed star of the place: the Cuban Mojito, whose zestful taste lies both in the Havana Club Añejo 3 Años used to prepare it, and in the cheerful Havanese pulse. The Cuban Mojito recipe has been kept by the Bodeguita del Medio's lovers and watched over by the proud Giraldilla, emblem of Havana City, whose steady look has ensured that Cuba's dearest heritage would remain unspoiled. Learn how to prepare the genuine Cuban Mojito from La Bodeguita del Medio on www.havana-mojito.com. For more information, see www.drinkaware.ie/www.drinkaware.co.uk.
Chairman's Reserve is a hand crafted blend of our finest double distilled pot and continuous still rums which have been personally selected by our Chairman.

Ron Santa Teresa is an independent family-owned company, built on more than 200 years of tradition. The Hacienda is located in the Valleys of Aragua, in the heart of Venezuela. Under the direction of the family\u2019s fifth generation the Hacienda produces, blends and ages luxury rums.

The Original. Caribbean Rum blended with natural spices. The Original""SAILOR JERRY"". KNOWN THE WORLD OVER FOR SOLID, BRIGHT, NEAT TATTOOING. ""MY WORK SPEAKS FOR ITSELF"". The father of old-school tattooing, Norman""Sailor Jerry""Collins was an innovator and a true independent spirit whose work is still revered today. A master craftsman, his artistry and integrity remain timeless as does the rum that bears his signature. Our family company makes this rum the authentic way - spiced&smooth. Mix it with something, or just pour, or just pour it over ice and let""our work speak for itself."".

Wine of Western Cape, South Africa. Sauvignon Blanc - White South African Wine. Tasting Notes. Gooseberry and tropical fruit flavours, fresh and dry with lengthy citrus finish. The Crested porcupines are widely represented in Southern Africa. They are covered in spines and quills which when raised present a formidable fence of sharp spikes. They are noisy animals and move with a ponderous gait accompanied by much snuffling and grunting. A diet of potatoes, pumpkin and root vegetables tend to make them a problem in farming areas. They are, however, nocturnal and shy and the families that reside at Boekenboutskloof are very welcome.
Absolutely, amazing good-value white from the Western Cape. Great just on its own.

Since 1912, the Osborn family have tended the 19th century vineyards at their d'Arenberg winery, located in McLaren Vale, South Australia. The close proximity of the vineyards to the coastal Gulf St. Vincent induces a beneficial cooling effect on the grapes. Many of McLaren Vale's best vineyards are on free-draining soils underlain with limestone, formed by the calcified remains of the local marine fauna. One such creature was the Hermit Crab, a reclusive little crustacean that inhabits the cast-off shells of others. The Osborn family thought the name appropriate for this, McLaren Vale's first ever Viognier Marsanne blend, as it is best enjoyed with shellfish and seafood dishes. Under the supervision of fourth generation family winemaker, Chester Osborn, the grapes, once crushed, were pressed by d'Arenberg's 19th century basket-presses which ensures the gentle extraction of the varieties' delicate fruit flavours, prior to fermentation.

Organic. Suitable for vegetarians, vegans and coeliacs. Organic still cider. Full-bodied and fruity cider matured in our lovingly-preserved old oak vats. Made with bittersweet apples grown in Soil Association certified organic orchards. In the organic orchards of the Wye Valley nature is in charge. The small yet juicy organic apples are pressed with all our know - how to make a perfectly crafted and refreshingly rich and fruity organic cider. A family firm make a firm favourite. Since Henry Weston first began producing cider in the Herefordshire village of Much Marcle over 130 years ago, we've always been proud to have a Weston at the helm. Every year, when harvest begins, we open our gates to tractors, trucks and trailers piled high with apples gathered from organic orchards. They are checked for quality and washed, ready for pressing. A state-of-the-art press squeezes out every last drop of juice before fermenting and then maturing it in old oak vats - our most treasured family heirlooms. And that's the secret to our flavoursome and full-bodied cider, the blending of old and new craftmanship overseen by our Master Cider Maker to create a uniquely time-honoured taste. product.productName: Chat-en-Oeuf Rouge 2010 Pays d'Oc, South of France -
product.productDescription: Wine of Languedoc, France. Pays d'Oc - Red French Wine. Juicy, rich and red. Tasting Notes. This luscious red is made from selected parcels of old vine Grenache and Syrah (aka Shiraz), making it a truly mouth-filling wine packed with rich, juicy and ripe berry fruit flavours, a touch of soft tannin and a subtle twist of spice. The Oc,or 'Pays d'Oc' as you'll see it on most labels, refers to the Languedoc-Roussillon region of southern France, known by the French as 'Le Midi'. Geographically the Oc covers an incredibly broad swathe of vineyards from the Rhône delta in the middle of southern France, arcing all the way round to the Spanish border on her Mediterranean seaboard. Planted here are both traditional grape varieties such as Grenache Gris (which makes very fine rosé) and Grenache Noir (try Pasquiers for a full-bodied flavoursome find); as well as the 'cépages améliorateurs' (varieties introduced in the last twenty to thirty years) such as Syrah and Merlot for reds, Viognier and Sauvignon Blanc for whites. Eric Monnin, Boutinot's winemaker responsible for the Languedoc, is constantly on the look-out for producers who have hidden gems, visiting domaines, seeking out new parcels as well as counselling winemakers before the harvest on e.g. softening harsh tannins in reds, or retaining acidity and expressing aromatics in whites. Then once the grapes have been picked, vinified and the wines barely finished, he tastes these 'brut de cuve' wines intensively and repeatedly over the next six months in collaboration with Samantha Bailey and Kim Tidy to select and blend the styles we seek and decide on their maturation, optimum bottling month and release date to the market.

Ripe plum, berry fruits and hints of spice, accentuated with a nuance of oak and an elegant, lingering soft texture. Oyster Bay Merlot is about elegance and intensity of fruit. The hero is always freshness of ripe fruit, spice and soft tannins on the palate. Oyster Bay is New Zealand's third largest wine maker and defines the stature and style of New Zealand wines. It produces elegant, assertive, Super-Premium wines, with glorious fruit flavours from the renowned regions of Marlborough and Hawke's Bay. Hawke's Bay's ancient alluvial river terraces provide for a superb mix of soils over gravelly, free-draining sub-soils. With a maritime climate, the vines are warmed by strong sunlight during the day, and cooled at night by Pacific ocean breezes. The grapes for Oyster Bay Merlot received a gentle pressing to release flavour without drawing out hard tannins. A large portion was aged in French barriques for 6 months to provide softness and complexity to the wine.""This juicy, ripe, blackcurrant-rich red offers a glimpse of the smooth, medium-bodied Bordeaux-style red that's the hallmark of the Hawke's Bay region""Anthony Rose, The Independent.

Waitrose Barossa Shiraz is made in Partnership with St Hallett Winery in Barossa, Australia. We have chosen to work with St Hallett because of their reputation for creating the finest quality Barossa Shiraz and their winemakers' enthusiastic and open-minded approach. This wine has been made by blending selected parcels of fruit from different sub regions of the Barossa, the Western and the Northern ridges for flavour and richness and the Eden Valley for complexity and structure. Maturation in French oak barrels adds finesse. It displays fresh ripe raspberry and blackberry fruit, has a rich, smooth, velvety texture and subtle chocolatey vanilla oak influence.

Wine of Clare Valley, Australia. Shiraz - Red Australian Wine. This wine honours the vision of pioneer Clare Valley winemaker Jim Barry. In 1964, Jim and his wife Nancy purchased 70 acres of prime grazing land from their gentleman neighbour Duncan McRae Wood and planted their first vineyard with shiraz. These mature, low-yielding vines consistently provide outstanding fruit which, since its inception in 1992, has established the McRae Wood as an exceptional example of Clare Shiraz. The McRae Wood has an enviable track record on the international and national wine show circuit, with past vintages amassing numerous trophies and gold medals. The 2008 McRae Wood Shiraz offers highly perfumed and floral aromas of cedar, jasmine and caraway seed. The palate has flavours of blackberry, cranberry, damson plums and red currants. Fine grained tannins are astutely balanced with natural acidity and a creamy finish. ""Treat and store well, decant shortly before drinking."". Peter Barry. To discover more, visit jimbarry.com

The wine is ripe and juicy with real depth to the blackberry and raspberry fruit, supported by soft, juicy tannins. This great Barossa winery goes from strength to strength. Toby Barlow, fresh from his stunning successes at Mitchelton in Victoria ensures that St Hallett remains one of the most forward looking wineries in Australia. In the heart of the Barossa Valley lies St Hallett one of the country\u2019s premier wine producers. Established by the Lindner Family in 1944 St Hallett is renowned for crafting full-flavoured, textured wines entirely from Barossa Valley fruit. The Shiraz for this wine is primarily from cooler southern and central Barossa Valley, whilst the Grenache is sourced from low yielding west and north western areas where the vines truly struggle to survive to produce intensely flavoured crops. This is an unoaked wine that is fermented in stainless steel tanks with yeast strains which are especially selected to highlight the aromas contributed by the Grenache and use the richness and pepper spice of the Shiraz to build up structure.

Wine of McLaren Vale, Australia. Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz-Merlot - Red Australian Wine. Church Block was the first wine the late Greg Trott produced under the Wirra Wirra label back in 1972. He took the name from one of the original vineyards, which runs next to the small Bethany Church (est. 1854) across the road from Wirra Wirra's century old ironstone cellars. Over four decades, the Church Block label has become an Australian favourite, consistently offering a smooth, soft red wine that balances the complexity sought by aficionados, with the approachability desired by those seeking pure drinking pleasure. The 2009 selection of Cabernet Sauvignon (51%), Shiraz (29%) and Merlot (20%) is another masterful blend. Matured in 70% French oak and 30% American oak barriques for 18 months, it is rich in fruit to enjoy in its youth, but with the structure to develop for a decade under careful cellaring.

He created them. Bottled them. Sold them. And has continued doing so ever since.

BY APPOINTMENT TO HER MAJESTY QUEEN ELIZABETH II. MANUFACTURERS OF ANGOSTURA AROMATIC BITTERS. A skilfully blended aromatic preparation of gentian in combination with a variety of vegetable colouring matter. Made with the same ingredients since 1824. PRODUCT OF TRINIDAD&TOBAGO. For the better guarantee of the genuineness of this aromatic bitters the label on every bottle bears the facsimile of the signature of Dr. J.G.B. Siegert. There are other aromatic bitters but only one ANGOSTURA, the brand name under which Dr. J.G.B. Siegert and his successors have sold their product throughout the world since 1830. It does not contain Angostura Bark and derives its name from the fact that it originated in the town of Angostura, Venezuela, renamed Ciudad Bolivar in 1846. ANGOSTURA aromatic bitters was first made in 1824 by Dr. J.G.B. Siegert in the town of Angostura, Venezuela. ANGOSTURA aromatic bitters may be distinguished from all other aromatic bitters by its fine flavour and aromatic odour. At the principal International Exhibition it has received the highest recognition. 44.7% alc/vol.

The Spirit of France since 1805. In 1805, Henri-Louis PERNOD first created what was to become the most celebrated spirit on the cafe terraces of 19th Century Paris. Many famous artists, painters, poets and writers discovered its charms and their works included several references totheir taste for this new aperitif. Crying out for lemonade and fruit. Sipsmith? Why 'Sipsmith'? Well, much the same way wordsmiths love to create all things wordical, we love to create all things sippical. Like this Summer Cup. First we distill our award winning London Dry Gin on our copper still, which is, and we're a little overexcited about this, the first such still in London since 1820. Then, inspired by the quintessentially English 'cups' of the 1800s, we blend it with a hostof fabulous summery fruits and flavours including infusions of Earl Grey tea, Lemon Verbena and Cucumber. The natural cloudiness comes from the real ingredients that we infuse to give our summer cup its wonderful character and depth of flavour. Aromatic yet dry, it's perfect for marrying with a mixer in the sun. Sipsmith: where old meets new and the two hit it off really quite spectacularly. Please sip responsibly. www.sipsmith.com
This bottle contains Pimm's Brandy Cup. Blended with a subtle hint of orange zest and spices. 25% vol. 17.5 UK units.

Double filtered. Brazilian spirit made from sugar cane. Gluten free. Velho Barreiro is one of the most appreciated""cachaças""in Brazil, because of its delicate aroma, due to the very careful way of double distillation. Use it for preparation of""caipirinha""or any other fruit cocktail (Passion fruit, Pineapple, Coconut, Mango, etc...) or simply pure, straight or on the rocks.

This natural fruit cream is produced from fresh cream and the unique fruit of the Marula tree. Amarula is a cream liqueur made from a blend of the unique marula fruit and stabilised cream. Unlike any other cream liqueur, Amarula is not made from a whisky or brandy base. The marula fruit is distilled to produce a fruit spirit base. . Because of its genuine African heritage, Amarula is more exotic than other cream liqueur brands. Deliciously smooth - every sip is pure pleasure. The spirit of Africa - Amarula originates from the southern plains of Africa where the marula fruit grows. The fruit itself has a light yellow skin, with deliciously juicy vitamin C packed flesh around a kernel rich in natural oils. The marula fruit attracts many animals - especially elephants - and is sometimes referred to as the""elephant tree""as elephants travel miles to gorge themselves on this delicious fruit. The marula tree plays a unique role in local tribal legend as the fruit is believed to have aphrodisiac properties and so features in local fertility rites. The marula tree is also known as""The Marriage Tree""and to this day tribal weddings take place beneath its branches. For all cocktail recipes and more visit our website: www.amarula.com

Originating deep in the Yucatán region, Kahlúa's story has grown alongside ripening coffee beans high in the mountains of Veracruz, Mexico. With a flavor as rich and distinct as the region, Kahlúa invites you to discover the stimulating taste of a mystical region and vibrant culture. For more information and recipes visit www.kahlua.com
This bottle contains Pimm's No. 1 the original mixer. Pimm's®spirit drink. Made since the year 1840, from a closely guarded, secret recipe.
Herb liqueur

The famous based Italian Liqueur with an aniseed base with elderberries macerated in alcohol and then aged in Finnish vats. Luxardo Sambuca is traditionally drunk alla mosca - with three coffee beans floating but is also a popular shooter - as a flamer, chilled straight, or layered with cream liqueur and is enjoyed in many cocktails.

NEW BOTTLE. REMEMBER THE GIFT OF THE PRINCE. SINCE 1745. PRINCE Charles Edward Stuart's LIQUEUR. A SECRET RECIPE OF HERBS, SPICES AND HEATHER HONEY, CRAFTED WITH AGED SCOTCH WHISKIES. AN DRAM BUIDHEACH, THE DRINK THAT SATISFIES. THE SPIRIT LIVES ON®. AFTER THE HEROIC JACOBITE REBELLION OF 1745 BONNIE PRINCE CHARLIE ESCAPED FROM SCOTLAND LEAVING BEHIND THE LEGACY OF HIS ROYAL RECIPE, WHICH REMAINED A SECRET FOR GENERATIONS ON THE ISLE OF SKYE.
AN INFUSION OF REAL ITALIAN LEMONS.25% vol.
Le Grand Cru de Pastis, produced in Provence using 48 locally grown herbs
Carefully distilled from the skins of selected red grapes grown in the Piedmont region.
Pimm's®spirit drink. A unique Pimm's®blend with blackberry&elderflower flavourings. A limited edition tipple, made from a blend honouring the Pimm's tradition, mixed with Blackberry and Elderflower.
Export strength London dry gin made from premium botanicals and distilled four times for a distinctive, crisp taste.

THE ORIGINAL. SPECIAL DRY LONDON GIN. DISTILLED IN GREAT BRITAIN SINCE 1769. ESTd. IN 1769 LONDON. GORDON'S DRY GIN. BY APPOINTMENT TO HER MAJESTY THE QUEEN TANQUERAY GORDON&CO. LTD GIN DISTILLERS. The Boar's Head, from the coat of arms belonging to the Gordon clan of Abergeldie has marked the quality of THE Original Dry London Gin for over 200 years.

Distilled from 100% grain neutral spirit. Kosher - Parev. London dry gin. A brazen breed, perfectly balanced with natural poppy, dragon eye and hints of crisp citrus. Bulldog guards the time-honoured tradition of distilling meeting all opposition with brilliant character and a palatable disposition. Respect its spirit and it will remain forever loyal. www.facebook.com/BulldogGin

PREPARED FROM WILD SLOE BERRIES AND GORDON'S GIN. BY APPOINTMENTTO HER MAJESTY THE QUEEN TANQUERAY GORDON&CO. LTD GIN DISTILLERS. SLOE GIN LIQUEUR. Sloes are the fruit of the wild blackthorn grown naturally in the countryside. Gordon's Sloe gin, made from only the finest sloe berries and steeped in the world's favourite gin, is a spirit with a dry yet fruity taste.

Six O'Clock Gin\u2122. Balance, poise and precision: three imperatives in the mind of engineer and inventor Edward Kain. With meticulous attention to detail he created mechanical works of art, documented in blueprints that are still treasured today. A blueprint for gin deserves the same balance, poise and precision, which Edward's great grandson, Michael, uses to make Six O'Clock Gin. Inspired by his forefather, Michael carefully selects and precisely balances Juniper with six other botanicals to chime together as sweetly as any timepiece. Orange Peel adds a citrus note in delightful harmony with floral Elderflower. The result is a clean, smooth and richly flavoured gin. Edward was known for restraint in his gin consumption and looked forward to 6 O'Clock; time for 'ginspiration'.
A molasses based gin with anaroma & taste of botanicals &citrus flavours.Full flavoured zesty, grain based gin made in the classic London style.

Distilled with olives, thyme, rosemary and basil. The authentic mediterranean""Gin Mare""is made in a custom designed still by blending individual distillations of arbequina olives, thyme, rosemary, basil, cardamom, coriander and ginger berries gathered from our own farms and citrus fruits. Soaked in advance for more than a year in special large clay jars.

Handcrafted in time-honoured tradition in small batches using an original 19th Century Gin still. No other Gin tastes like it because no other Gin is made like it. Hendrick's is made using the highest quality neutral grain spirit, eleven different botanicals, rose petals and most unusually cucumber. Distilled and bottled in Girvan, South West Scotland. Presented in a small Victorian apothecary style bottle with a cork stopper. It is not for everyone. Only available in selected off trade outlets and in the non-trade at top-end style bars. Double Gold Medal at the recent San Francisco World Spirit Competition. Wall St. Journal Gin of the year 2003. ABV: 41.4%.

A premium London Dry gin, distilled from 100% neutral grain spirit.Bombay Sapphire is a London Dry premium gin, which is uniquely different from other gins in the marketplace. This difference lies in the fragrances and flavours of its ten exotic botanicals coupled with a unique distillation process called Vapour Infusion. It's a unique blend of Mediterranean lemon peel, juniper berries, almonds and orris, balanced by a heady mix of coriander, liquorice, angelica and cassia bark and spiced with cubeb berries and grains of paradise. When combined according to a recipe dating back to 1761 something exquisite is brought to Bombay Sapphire.Unlike some other gins, which 'boil' their botanicals together with the spirit, Bombay Sapphire distils its spirit alone. The spirit vapour from this distillation then gently passes through a copper basket containing the botanicals. This infuses the subtle aromatic flavours from each of the ten botanicals into the spirit vapour resulting in a crisp, delicately balanced taste and making Bombay Sapphire the most elegant and versatile of dinner guests.
Dry gin.

product.productName: Heston from Waitrose Earl Grey & Lemon Gin -
product.productDescription: Dry British gin distilled with all of the classic botanicals including juniper, citrus peel, almond, coriander, orris root, liquorice and angelica. “The addition of Earl Grey with its aromatic bergamot makes this a spirit with real spirit” - Heston Blumenthal

Copper distilled in London. London dry gin. Sipsmith? Why 'Sipsmith'? Well, much the same way wordsmiths love to create all things wordical, we love to create all things sippical. Like gin. We hand craft our spirits in tiny batches of around two hundred bottles, with skill, care and an almost fetishistical love. First we distill English barley spirit with ten carefully selected botanicals in our copper still, which is, and we're a little overexcited about this, the first such still to launch in London since 1820. Then we blend it with the exceptionally pure water of Lydwell Spring, the source of the Thames. The result is a London Dry Gin that is smooth, full of character and exploding with flavour. Sipsmith: where old meets new and the two hit it off really quite spectacularly.

Distilled in the heart of the city. Authentic premium. Made with 100% grain spirit. Based on James Burrough's original 19th century recipe, the botanicals in beefeater gin are steeped for 24 hours prior to distillation resulting in a complex, yet perfectly balanced gin of depth&integrity. Wild juniper combines with the subtle spice of coriander&the citrus freshness of lemons&Seville oranges for a vibrant gin suitable for every occasion.

With rare rangpur limes&other botanicals. 100% grain neutral spirits. A distinctive gin distilled with rare Rangpur limes and other fine botanicals. The secret of this spirit lies in the flavour of the Rangpur lime, which gives a characteristic, mild and juicy zest. The result is a subtle and refreshing taste with a satisfying smooth finish.

A premium, full-strength London Dry gin, distilled the old way in a 109 year old copper pot still, at a 200 year old distillery. Made from a unique blend of 8 botanicals from around the world. The taste.... Complex and aromatic, with hints of orange, lemon, nutmeg and cloves. Try it with... A premium tonic, a dash of elderflower cordial and lots of ice, for a new take on the classic G&T.

Elegant and crisp. Grown, distilled and bottled in Herefordshire, England. Made from the apples grown on our farm. Single estate English apple gin. The most complicated gin in the world... Thank you for choosing our gin - it is a relatively unknown fact that gin is made out of vodka, so when we set out to make our fine gin we needed the perfect vodka. So after much experimenting, we have turned our organic apples into cider&turned our cider into vodka then distilled our vodka intothis elegantly crisp gin to make the perfect gin martini (because a real martini is made from gin!). Each batch is distilled 100 times by passing twice through our copper pot&unique 70 foot column, with 42 bubble plates, then finished in our pretty little carter head style still, 'Ginny', to give you this gin with tears and a perfect pedigree. And I think... ""... When you are proud of making something put your name on it."". William Chase

Distilled four times. Made from world's finest botanicals. 100% grain neutral spirits. London dry gin. Charles Tanqueray began distilling in 1830 and Tanqueray gin continues his legacy of excellence. The highest quality spirit and finest botanicals, picked at the peak of their freshness, are carefully crafted to produce its exceptional, much revered taste.

100% grain neutral spirits. Fresh botanicals and hints of citrus give Tanqueray No. Ten its exquisite flavour and smooth finish. Tanqueray No. Ten is a refreshingly unique spirit, which makes a truly fresh tasting martini.

The authentic Victorian style of gin. Hayman's Old Tom Gin, distilled from a family recipe, is an authentic mark of English heritage. A quintessentially English style of gin consumed during 19th century Victorian England. A smooth, botanically intensive and flavourful gin, with a hint of sweetness, reflecting the style of the age.

Original recipe. Wild English sloe berries gently steeped in our London dry gin. We have been making the finest, handcrafted gins since 1863. Hayman's sloe gin is a traditional English liqueur made to a long standing family recipe. Wild hand-picked sloe berries, harvested in the autumn from the blackthorn tree, are gently steeped for several months with Hayman's gin. The final blend is a rich, ruby red liqueur, bursting with smooth and intense bittersweet fruit flavours.

International Spirits Challenge 2012 - Trophy and Gold. No.3 is made to Berry Bros own recipe by distillers with over three centuries of experience and expertise. With Juniper at its heart, No.3 embodies the traditional character of a London Dry Gin. At 46% No.3 London Dry Gin is the ideal strength for a classic Dry Martini. Nose. Bright, crisp and fresh with an uplifting welcome of juniper. Palate. Juniper to the fore, supported by floral notes and spicy, warm cardamom. Plenty of citrus 'zing' complemented by the gingery spiciness of coriander. Finish. The earthy dryness of angelica kicks in. No. 3 London Dry Gin is made in time-honoured fashion born of 300 years of experience using traditional copper pot stills. Essential botanicals of juniper, sweet orange peel, angelica root and coriander are combined with cardamom seeds and grapefruit feel to deliver a perfectly balanced smooth, fresh London Dry Gin. Overlooking St. James's palace in the heart of London, No. 3 has been home to Berry Bros.&Rudd for more than three centuries since its foundation by the widow Bourne in 1698, during the reign of king William III. Berrys began supplying wines and spirits to the British royal family during the reign of King George III - a service that was officially recognised in 1903 when the company was awarded its first royal warrant - and it is a tradition that Berrys still proudly maintains to this day. No.3 London Dry Gin is distilled to a proprietary recipe of Berry Bros&Rudd, London's oldest wine and spirit merchant. The name No.3 refers to the address in St James's Street, London: the home of Berry Bros since 1698. Berry Bros.&Rudd currently holds Royal Warrants for H.M. The Queen and H.R.H The Prince of Wales. The Key. Origin/Location. The key on the bottle was inspired by the key to the lock in the door of The Parlour at the heart of the shop at No.3 St James\u2019s Street. The Parlour, in many ways, is the inner sanctum of No.3 St James\u2019s Street. It is one of the oldest chambers in the shop; a room that is steeped in history and tradition. The No.3 key therefore unlocks the secrets and traditions of an extraordinary institution and symbolises our values of quality, authority and integrity.

Plymouth Gin\u2122. Documented at the turn of the 20th century as the gin used in the marguerite-the original dry Martini cocktail, Plymouth Gin\u2122 remains one of the true classics. Crafted in England's oldest working gin distillery and distilled with soft Dartmoor water&sweet botanicals, it's no wonder Plymouth has been favoured by many since 1793.

A delightful floral gin inspired by the true beauty of nature. BLOOM is a delicate floral London Dry Gin, inspired by the natural flora of an English country garden. Chamomile, pomelo and honeysuckle were chosen as the three key botanicals \u2013 each one helping in its own unique way to create a more delicate and subtle gin drinking experience.
Hand crafted. Copper stilled in the heart of Southwold. Handcrafted&copper stilled using East Anglian malted barley, a selected of six botanicals are used to create our distinct&characterful gin.

Handcrafted from pure grain spirit and time-honoured Celtic botanicals. MADE WITH FIVE CELTIC BOTANICALS. ROWAN BERRY. HEATHER. COUL BLUSH APPLE. DANDELION. BOG MYRTLE. A unique infusion of pure Scottish Highland water, six traditional and five Celtic botanicals, hand-infused by our Gin Master in a Copper Berry Chamber for an invigorating naturally balanced taste. Premium handcrafted gin.
Distilled and bottled in Herefordshire, England. Seville orange gin

This bottle of Portobello Road Gin 171 was created by the award-winning licensed victualers of the Ginstitute Messrs. Gerard Feltham, Jake F Burger and Paul Andrew Lane. Each individually numbered bottle bearing a triptych of their unique signatures. Every drop of Portobello Road Gin is distilled under the watchful eye of eight-generation gin distiller Mr Charles Maxwell. The recipe calls for a blend of nine completey natural botanicals and eschews the contemporary trend for ever more esoteric ingredients, instead saluting London's distillers of the past. A classic botanical selection, with cassia bark and nutmeg concomitant, contrives a timeless London Dry Gin with a depth of flavour and character to suit all occasions and libations. Portobello Road Gin: A capital bracer. I do undertake to manufacture and sell distilled London dry gin of only the highest quality, using only natural botanicals and grain neutral spirit of 100% purity. This gin is guaranteed to be as fresh, dry, lively and perfect as it was on the day it was made. J Burger, G. Feltham, P. Lane

With cucumber&other natural flavourings. UK's favourite gin brand. A sophisticated and contemporary twist to the gin and tonic experience. Gordon's London Dry gin with natural cucumber flavourings, for a refreshingly clean and crisp flavour. Perfect with ice, tonic and a thin slice of cucumber and lemon. Distilled in Great Britain since 1769

Wine of south-west Sicily, Italy. Fiano - White Sicilian Wine. Dry and aromatic with apricot and honey flavours and a subtle hint of almond blossom. We've perfected the art of growing the unusual Fiano grape which produces all the aromas and tastes of Sicily - honey, citrus and wild flowers. It's absolutely delicious, very fruity and perfect for drinking with salads, grilled chicken and seafood. Our beautiful vineyards have been growing for centuries along the rugged coast of south-west Sicily. Over the years, the skills needed to make great wines have been passed down through generations and remain at the heart of our community life here today. Did you know that the Inycon growers pioneered the planting of Fiano in Sicily? For recipes and to learn more about our way of life, please visit www.inycon-growers.com
Lifted, pungent herbal aromas and succulent apricot fruit flavour from one of the very best Soave masters.

product.productName: LaVis Storie di Vite Pinot Grigio -
product.productDescription: Wine of Dolomiti, Italy. Pinot Grigio - White Italian Wine. Storie di Vite represents very prestigious wines from Trentino. This Pinot Grigio is elegant and refreshing, displaying notes of citrus and pear. A pale straw colour, with a floral nose. The palate is full and aromatic. Place of origin: Vineyards on the hills north of Trento, in Trentino region. Grape variety: Pinot Grigio. Storie di Vite is a selection of the most important Trentino wines, through which the entire tradition of the La-vis winery production is expressed.
Excellent value Pinot Grigio, an unbeatable crowd-pleaser. Always well received at parties. great on its own or with fish
Full of rich fruit flavours, citrus, honey and a long fresh finish.
Crisp dry citrus flavoured Inzolia/ Catarratto from sunkissed Sicily. Perfect pasta wine!

product.productName: Moncaro Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Marche, Italy -
product.productDescription: Intrinsic almond and citrus flavours wrapped in a fresh, light style. Fine partner for chicken or pasta.

PORDOTTO IN ITALIA 2007. The Cortese grape is traditionally grown in the area around the town of Gavi, where it gives dry, lemony white wines. This version is fermented in stainless steel tanks to give a clean and elegant flavour.

Wine of Orvieto, Italy. Grechetto, Trebbiano and Chardonnay - White Italian Wine. Light and refreshing in style with delicate flavours of apples and peaches and a trademark hint of almonds on the finish.

Pinot Grigio - White Italian Wine. Canaletto Pinot Grigio comes from Veneto region, in the north east of Italy, home to Venice and Lake of Garda. This elegant wine is ideal on its own, or with creamy pasta sauces, fish dishes and white meats. Canaletto Wines are the very essence of Italy, each telling a story of a special Italian region and its unique wine styles.

Set up in 2003, Adria Vini is a winemaking venture jointly owned by Boutinot and Araldica Vini Piemontesi, the leading co-operative in Piemonte. All areas of production, from grape selection through to vinification, maturation, blending and bottling are meticulously overseen by Araldica's Claudio Manera and Lella Burdese. Working closely with growers and cooperatives, our aim is to produce a range of authentic, well-priced wines from local grape varieties. The mainstay of white wine production is Pinot Grigio, sourced from the Pavia region south of Milan, Friuli and the Veneto. New projects in the Veneto and Sicily from the 2008 vintage see the addition of Prosecco, Grillo and Catarratto. The reds come from mature, low yielding vineyards in Sicily, Puglia and Abruzzo, the source of some of Europe's most undervalued and characterful wines.

product.productName: La Monetta Gavi del Comune di Gavi -
product.productDescription: Very fine Gavi with flavours of citrus, nuts and hints of grass. Superb with roast chicken.
From the hills around Rome, this is full of nut and citrus characters. A delicious partner to seafood.

Wine of Trentino, Italy. A delicious wine with a refreshing, distinctive, satisfying finish. Pinot Grigio - White Italian Wine. This delicious Pinot Grigio has refreshing aromas of white peach and melon and a zesty citrus finish. Fruity and smooth on the palate, it is ideal as an aperitif and matches perfectly with seafood and creamy pasta dishes. Located in North East Italy, Trentino is one of the most dynamic and progressive wine producing regions in Italy. Most of the vineyards are situated on medium-high altitude hillsides which provide ideal conditions, with climates ranging from cool Alpine to mild Mediterranean.

Wine of Italy. Vino Bianco - White Italian Wine. This is a fresh, fruity white wine with ripe stone fruit flavours and natural zest. Serve chilled as a great aperitif or to accompany chicken, fish or creamy pasta dishes. Facebook: Off-Piste Wines
Aromatic with notes of ripe peaches and almonds. Excellent depth & minerality on the finish.
Arneis, a forgotten grape of Italy, well worth discovering. Excellent with grilled fish.

product.productName: Lavis Vigneti di Montagna Pino Grigio -
product.productDescription: Wine of Trentino, Italy. Suitable for vegetarians. Pinot Grigio - White Italian Wine. The grapes for this wine were hand harvested from our vineyards on the slopes of the dolomite foothills (between 200m - 500m), the cool Trentino mountain nights contribute to a long ripening season and the development of bright pure intense flavours. The bouquet is elegant and complex with hints of pear and apple. The palate is dry but supple and supported with a refreshing minerality. The location of the vineyards, with their specific microclimates and unique terroirs makes""Vigneti di Montagna""a completely original range of wines.
Wine of Orvieto, Italy. White Italian Wine. this is Umbria's most famous and renowned white wine, produced in a large area around the striking hill town of Orvieto.
A fine wine from the southern shores of Lake Garda. Great with seafood based pasta.
DELLE VENEZIE
Expressive and powerful Pinot Grigio from the Alto Adige. Great matched with scallops.
A classic southern Italian white made from Greco, Fiano and Falanghina. A must try.

Wine of Italy. Bianco - White Italian Wine. Lambrusco Bianco is medium sweet, slightly sparkling, deliciously fruity and easy to drink. It is made from the Lambrusco grape varieties and has a pleasant finish. Ready to drink now.
From the top Verdicchio producer. Fine with great mineral complexity. Lovely with lighter pasta dishes.

Wine of Viré-Clessé, France. Suitable for vegetarians and vegans. White French Wine. Mature Chardonnay vines, averaging 40 years old, and the unique Jurassic chalk soils of the region, both contribute to a wine of intensity and complexity, with a good concentration of fruit and no oak influence. Elegant peach and fresh apple flavours shine through. This is fine white Burgundy at an affordable price. Serve chilled with full flavoured fish dishes, seafood or chicken. ""Viré-Clesséis one of the newest Burgundy appellations created in 1998 to acknowledge the superior quality of the wines from around the villages of Viréand Clesséin the north of the Maconnais region.

Wine of Bordeaux, France. Fruity and elegant. Sauvignon Blanc - White French Wine. A beautiful pale yellow dress with green reflections. An elegant and fine nose, with floral and fruity flavours. Well-balanced, with a fresh, mineral and lengthy fruity final with floral nuances of white peach and bark of tangerine. Specialist in the wines of Bordeaux since 1818 and selecting the best""cuvées""from other principal French wine areas, Calvet is a French brand, distributed in more than 100 countries.
Fermented and matured in oak, butterscotch and vanilla flavours abound with smoky, pecan spice.
Mineral and citrus complexity to the fore in a classic Loire Sauvignon. Perfect with indulgent fish dishes.
Elegant and expressive Sauvignon with green-leaf and gunflint notes. Fantastic with goat's cheese.

product.productName: Laurent Miquel Nocturnes Viognier IGP Pays d'oc -
product.productDescription: Wine of Saint Chinian, France. White French Wine. Vendanges Nocturnes, Night harvest 'Viognier'. Laurent Miquel is a young vigneron specialising in the production of Viognier wines in the Languedoc hills in Southern France. He picks his grapes during the night when cooler temperatures ensure that the delicate Viognier fruit is in top condition. Immediate pressing of the grapes ensures a delicious white wine that is crisp, balanced and aromatic. Delicate perfumes of ripe apricot, pear and honeysuckle make this an ideal wine for an aperitif. Also delicious served with seafood dishes such as steamed sea bass, grilled prawns or Thai spiced crabcakes. Serve Chilled.
Premier cru from village next to Puligny and Chassagne. Great value. Enjoy with poultry in cream sauces.
A fine Meursault with elegant citrus aromas and ripe, rich finish. Superb with scallops in cream sauce.
Top-notch Sauvignon Blanc from old vines handled with loving care. Grassy aromas and gooseberry fruit.

product.productName: Cuvée Pêcheur IGP Vin de France South of France -
product.productDescription: A gently aromatic but bone dry white from sunny Southern France. The perfect party wine.

product.productName: Pujalet IGP Pays de Gers South of France -
product.productDescription: Lip-smacking lemon zest flavours with a heady meadow-flower bouquet. Would pair well with Thai cuisine.

Waitrose Sancerre 'La Franchotte' is made in partnership with Joseph Mellot in the village of Sancerre in the Central Vineyards of the Loire Valley. They have blended grapes from their own vineyards and from other parcels planted on different soils in the Sancerre appellation to add an extra dimension to this wine. Classic Sauvignon, with pure, intense flavours of gooseberries and a hint of apricot, mineral and floral notes and lovely zesty acidity. Its flinty elegance balances the weighty, ripe fruit to give a deliciously complex wine. Best served with fish, white meat, vegetarian dishes such as asparagus risotto or goat's cheese; equally as a refreshing and revitalising aperitif. Enjoy alcohol in moderation.

product.productName: Cave de Lugny Chardonnay Mâcon-Villages Burgundy, France -
product.productDescription: Great-value white Burgundy with mellow honey and melon flavours. Try with chicken or soft cheeses.

Wine of France. Chardonnay-Viognier - White French Wine. La Châsse Chardonnay-Viognier is sourced from the finest vineyards of France. Our winemakers carefully select the noble grapes to create this elegant blend of Chardonnay and Viognier. This round and harmonious white wine displays ripe, exotic and fruity aromas and is in a fresh, lively, easy-drinking style on the palate. The name La Châsse is derived from the historic chest that contained the great reliquaries of the Pontiffs who lived in Avignon during the 14th century.
A fresh, crisp and refreshingly dry white from the western Loire Valley in northern France
Lightly oaked Chardonnay from sunny climes with mango fruit notes. Excellent with white fish.

Waitrose Chablis is made in partnership with Cave des Vignerons de Chablis in the world-famous region in northern Burgundy. We have chosen to work with them because of their access to a high proportion of the best quality fruit in the region, the expertise of the wine-maker and his ability to produce this wine from a blend of the best vats. This classic dry white wine comes from the northern most region of Burgundy, where the soil contains ancient fossils of marine life. This wine is made entirely from the traditional Chardonnay grape variety and picks up a subtle minerality from the unique ""terroir"". The wine is dry, with crisp acidity and great depth of fresh citrus fruit flavour in youth, developing complexity as it ages. Serve lightly chilled as an aperitif or with seafood, fish and white meat dishes. Enjoy alcohol in moderation.
Named after the famous Solutré Rock near Pouilly-Fuissé. Enjoy as a lightly chilled apéritif.
A fresh and lively white wine with aromas of citrus and spicy apricot, made from Rhône grape varieties.
Chardonnay

Wine of Bordeaux, France. Sauvignon Blanc - White French Wine. Calvet Limited Release comes from specially selected grapes that fully exhibit the flavour of Sauvignon Blanc. Crushed leaf and ripe citrus fruits on the nose give way to a clean and intensely refreshing fruit flavour on the palate. A wine to be enjoyed when in full relax mode - with food or just on its own.

product.productName: Ackerman Chenin Blanc Vin de France Loire, France -
product.productDescription: Wine of France. Chenin Blanc - White French Wine

DEPUIS 1864.GRAND VIN DE BORDEAUX.Delor is a renowned Bordeaux merchant house that was founded in 1864. Our winemakers have selected this wine from the finest terroirs in order to offer the best quality Bordeaux Blanc, working with partner vinegrowers carefully choosing only the best grapes in order to produce the most representative wine.Delor Bordeaux Blanc is a blend of Semillon and Sauvignon Blanc. It displays lovely fresh notes of citrus fruits and peaches with a delicious refreshing, crisp palate.Our winemakers have chosen to use a screw cap closure for this wine in order to preserve its freshness and zesty fruit flavours.12% vol.

product.productName: Fief Guérin Muscadet Côtes de Grandlieu Sur Lie, Loire, France -
product.productDescription: Single vineyard Muscadet with a yeasty, tangy grapefruit flavour. Superb with Japanese tempura.
A mesmerising blend of aromatic grapes from a true Alsatian master. Savour with sweet and sour dishes.

This wine is produced by Cave de Lugny from Chardonnay grapes grown in the village of Cave de Lugny, which is located in the Mâconnais region of southern Burgundy.Cave de Lugny\u2019s winemaker, Grégoire Pissot, is dedicated to producing the very best wines that this region has to offer, using a combination of traditional and modern wine making techniques, and the result is a wine that is very elegant, crisp and smooth, with citrus&pear flavours, and a nice minerality.This wine makes the perfect aperitif, but is also a superb accompaniment to poultry, seafood and salads.
Top-class, classic white Graves – steely and very mineral in style. Ideal partner for fish with dill.

product.productName: Domaine Henri Clerc Puligny-Montrachet Burgundy, France -
product.productDescription: Wine of Puligny-Montrachet, Burgundy, France. Suitable for vegetarians. Vieilles Vignes - Dry White French Wine. Displaying real complexity and elegance, this is a stunning wine with great depth and richness, and superb balance. Rich citrus fruit flavours are backed up with a lovely mineral streak. Puligny-Montrachet is one of the most famous regions in Burgundy, producing some of the very best white wines in the world. This fantastic example is produced by Domaine Henri Clerc, one of the top growers in the region, and now owned and run by the legendary winemaker Vincent Girardin.
Classy Chablis with a subtle aqueous and flinty, mineral character. Traditional match for shellfish.
Latour have a great tradition for crafting classic, elegant wines. Try with grilled poultry.
Immensely popular, bright Sauvignon Blanc with grassy, lemon freshness. A fine match for salmon.

This distinctive white wine is sourced from the well-regarded cooperative situated in the bustling village of Turckheim. Nestled in the foothills of the Vosges mountains, with its varied patchwork of soils, the winery can draw upon a broad supply of fine Gewurztraminer grapes. The Gewurztraminer variety grows exceptionally well in the warm dry, Alsatian climate to make a classically rich, opulent style of wine that is markedly full-bodied and very spicy with a dry finish. Golden coloured, with an intense rose petal and lychee nose, and a wonderful refreshing exotic peach, pear and apricot palate finishing dry, this wine is typical of the region where the local gastronomy demands satisfying wines to accompany their generously flavoursome foods.

Wine of France. Chablis Premier Cru Vaillons - White French Wine. The William Fèvre estate owns more than 50 hectares in the heart of the Chablis vineyard, of which more than half are in Premiers Crus and Grands Crus. From manual harvesting to ageing in vats and neutral oak casks, everything is done to fully express the characteristics of each appellation and to preserve terroirs and natural balances.
Classic Burgundian Chardonnay with hints of citrus and spicy oak. Try serving this with monkfish.

product.productName: Cave de Beblenheim Pinot Gris Reserve Alsace, France -
product.productDescription: Wine of France. Pinot Gris - White French Wine. This elegant white wine comes from the pretty village of Beblenheim, where the well-established cooperative has supplied the local people and those overseas with wines of exceptional value and typicity for generations. The winemaking team draw upon a wide diversity of grapes to blend the right style for their customer. As a variety, Pinot Gris produces exceptionally fine results in the dry, sunny Alsatian climate. Here, vines situated on the marl, clay and limestone escarpments of the Vosges mountains reach an effortless maturity. Pale golden in colour, with a delicate musky aroma that gives way to an intriguingly honeyed palate, yet this wine is dry with a charming balance. The finish is full flavoured, soft and round, making it the perfect choice to partner all manner of food accompaniments.
Zippy vibrant white with crisp citrus fruit, with a supple ripe, tropical palate. Chill
A wine where intense gooseberry fruit flavours shine through. Partner with grilled sea bass
A stunningly fresh and aromatic wine with vibrant fruit flavours. Enjoy with chicken or Asian dishes.
Elegant fine white Burgundy from four premier cru vineyards. Try matching this with a fish pie.
Pungent, lemony Sauvignon Blanc showing the elegance of Sancerre. Would work well with quiches.
A deliciously, fresh, zesty & dry Sauvignon Blanc, with a lovely purity & length.
A fresh, crisp, dry white from 100% Sauvignon Blanc, from the famous vineyards of Sancerre

product.productName: Cave de Buxy Montagny Premier Cru Les Coères Burgundy, France -
product.productDescription: Wine of France. Montagny - White French Wine. Intense and mineral, this Montagny 1er Cru expresses a chalky minerality combined with generous notes of pears and toasted almond. The palate is generous and rich, offering a pure finish. Terrific with grilled lobster, sweetbreads, trout in almonds and white meats.

product.productName: Domaine Pascal Bouchard Chablis Grand Cru Burgundy, France -
product.productDescription: One of only seven grand cru sites in Chablis, Vaudésir produces wines with fantastic finesse and purity.
A zesty, crisp Sauvignon from the Loire, with fresh green apple and gooseberry fruit.

Chardonnay GRAPE VARIETY. This White Burgundy comes form the Maconnais region south of the Cote d'Or. It has been produced by five well-reputed small growers who banded together in 2002 to form Vincent de Vignaud. Made from Chardonnay grown around Pouilly-Vinzelles, neighbour to the famous Pouilly-Fuisse, this wine offers great value from an up-and-coming area. Fresh and dry, with flavours of citrus fruit, it is elegant balanced and complex, with good concentration and creamy texture. It finished clean with a nice streak of minerality typical of the region.
A crisp, dry, fresh white made from the Sauvignon Blanc grape in the upper Loire valley

Wine of France. Riesling Grafenreben - White French Wine. This noble white wine is produced from grapes grown in the small province of Grafenreben, meaning 'the Baron's vines,' situated in the east-facing Zellenberg commune in the pretty region of Alsace. Often referred to as the king of white grape varieties, Riesling has exceptional attributes that can produce exquisite white wines. Know for its floral, mineral character and racy, firm acidity, good Riesling has a lightness of touch and precisely defined palate. Pale yellow in colour, highly aromatic with a lemony character and a crisp, fresh palate, this Grafenreben Riesling has a sublime complexity. Layers of citrus fruit and a steely mineral backbone support the bright acidity right through to a long, ethereal finish.

product.productName: Domaine Paul Blanck Gewurztraminer Alsace, France -
product.productDescription: Wine of Alsace, France. Bronze Medal 2013 IWSC. Suitable for vegetarians and vegans. Gewurztraminer - White French Wine. Domaine Paul Blanck is situated in Kientzheim, a beautiful mediaeval village in Alsace, in northern France. The Blanck family have owned vineyards here for generations but their traditional heritage has not prevented the search for perfection through the adoption of modern winemaking practices. The use of a screw-top closure helps to preserve the floral, rose petal aromas of this wine made from the Gewurztraminer grape variety. This is a fresh, crisp white with rich flavours of rose and lychee and an attractive hint of spice on the palate. This Gewurztraminer is delicious chilled as an aperitif with canapés or tapas and is also a great partner to slightly spicy food. \u201CGewurz\u201D means \u201Cspice\u201D in German, which perfectly describes the exotic flavours within this delicious wine. Floral and off-dry with power and elegance, this wine from Alsace in North-Eastern France goes brilliantly with tapas or sweet and savoury canapés. Also great with slightly spicy, exotic food or with mature soft cheese. The screw cap closure guarantees freshness.

Clos de Nouys is a small single estate, based in Vallée de Nouys, one of the finest vineyards in the heart of Vouvray. This wine is produced from Chenin Blanc grapes, mainly hand-picked. Light yellow in colour with green reflections. The nose is floral - acacia - with aromas of fresh almonds. The mouth is well balanced between roundness and freshness. 12.5% vol.
Rare Burgundian Sauvignon Blanc in a zesty, gooseberry Sancerre style. Team with asparagus or soft cheeses.

product.productName: Joseph Drouhin Rully, Premier Cru Burgundy, France -
product.productDescription: Barrel-fermented with mesmerising aromas of freshly baked bread. Superb with shellfish and chicken.

Wine of France. Chardonnay - White French Wine. ""11300""refers to the postcode of the cool climate region of Limoux, where this deliciously refreshing and delicate Chardonnay come from. Terroir 11300 is the very best expression of this wonderful land&has a subtle balance of crisp citrus, honeyed fruit and minerality on the palate. A pure delight as an aperitif and a joyous partner to seafood and white meat dishes. Ecologically responsible. James&Catherine Kinglake. Follow us on Twitter@begude

Wine of France. Fresh grape aromas harvested at dawn. Saint Mont - White French Wine. Saint Mont appellation is located at the foot hills of the Pyrénées, in South West France, on the rolling hills of the Gers department. The growers had secured the rebirth of their native vine and managed to bring out their unique character. Le PasséAuthentique is a tribute to these indigenous grapes: Gros Manseng, Arrufiac and Petit Courbu. A rigorous selection is done in the vineyards and the wine is aged on lees for a period of three months which add complexity to the wine. Clear pale yellow with bright tints. Nose: intense in fruit with subtle vanilla scents and distinct citrus notes. Palate: fruity on the palate (melon, peach), rich and round. It then evolves smoothly towards a persistent and slightly lemony note.

product.productName: Domaine de Sainte Rose Coquille d'Oc -
product.productDescription: Blend of grape varieties make an exceptionally versatile wine. Easy to drink fresh and fruity.
Chenin Blanc grapes make this zippy honeyed wine tasting of juicy peach. Excellent with baked fish.

Wine of France. Muscat Sec - White South French Wine. This dry wine is made from Muscatàpetits grains, the oldest and noblest variety of Muscat. It is a thoroughly enjoyable French wine with an intensely aromatic nose of lychees and spring blossom. On the palate the floral, grapey Muscat character gives way to a clean, crisp and long finish. Sea breezes through our Muscat vines temper the warm Mediterranean sun creating idyllic growing conditions. Our wine is delightfully aromatic with luscious tropical fruit flavours and we love it chilled with scallops and other fresh seafood. Thierry Boudinaud - Winemaker
Full flavoured, creamy Chardonnay with an intriguing mineral backbone. A fine match for haddock or cod.
A glorious wine with spicy oak and luscious flavours of pear and lime. Great with rich chicken dishes.
Specially blended in the Loire Valley, using fresh, appley Chenin. Classic match for goat's cheese.

product.productName: Dourthe La Grande Cuvée Sauvignon Blanc Bordeaux, France -
product.productDescription: Wine of Bordeaux, FranceSauvignon Blanc - White French Wine.Made from 100% Savignon Blanc, Dourthe La Grande Cuvée is characterised by outstanding aromatic intensity, dislaying striking citrus fruit and blackcurrant bud notes, and exemplary freshness. This perfect balance results in an exceptionally elegant wine.Established in 1840, and boasting a portfolio of highly prized Chateaux, Dourthe is the benchmark for high quality Bordeaux wines.

A clean, crispo white, full of refreshing, citrusy flavours. Made from Sauvignon Blanc grapes, grown in the sunny PAys D'OC region of France. Good with simple fish and chicked dishes, or a light goat's cheese salad.

product.productName: Chateau de Fesles La Chapelle 2011 Anjou Blanc -
product.productDescription: From an historic Cháteau this wine shows dried fruit and honey notes. Incredible fruit concentration.

Wine of France. Floral and fruity. Pouilly Fumé- White French Wine. Nice yellow green colour. Powerful nose with floral and fruity aromas. Well balanced wine, fleshy and persistent. Specialist in the wines of Bordeaux since 1818 and selecting the best""cuvées""from other principal French wine areas, Calvet is a French brand, distributed in more than 100 countries.

Highland single malt Scotch whisky. From the highest distillery in Scotland, set in the windswept Grampian mountains with their unlimited supply of fresh spring water, comes this delightfully gentle, delicately smoky malt. The Gaelic word from which the name Dalwhinnie comes is Dail-coinneeamh, which translates as""meeting place"". The highest distillery in Scotland was founded on these bleak, wind-swept central Highland pastures in 1898. The classic Highland malt, Dalwhinnie ages slowly to develop a remarkable character. Fifteen years of gentle ageing make it a smooth, subtle malt without a trace of harshness. Heart-warming yet also mellow and honeyed, its combination of delicacy and depth sets is apart. Where it matters, Dalwhinnie retains the old ways. Increasingly rare wooden worm-tubs, a landmark outside the distillery as distinctive as its pagoda roofs, help this remain a spirit of real character. Hidden depths are also apparent. Smooth-tasting Dalwhinnie yields flavours of creamy vanilla and a heather-honey sweetness, finishing in a smoky Highland glow of surprising intensity. Dalwhinnieis the remote Highland destination on a journey around Scotland's six malt whisky making regions. The other Classic Malts are: Glenkinchie - Lowland. Cragganmore - Speyside. Talisker - Skye. Oban - West Highland. Lagavulin - Islay

Welcoming, vibrant and rewardingA classic Speyside single malt matured in a combination of Traditional oak and Sherry oak casks for a minimum of ten years.Nestling in the heart of Speyside is the village of Aberlour where a source of exceptionally purespring water known as St. Drostan's Well inspired James Fleming to build his distillery in 1897.This richness of the natural environment combined with the soft and pure water creates Aberlour single malt, a distinctive whisky of generous character.Colour: Gold.Nose: The dry, fresh, fruity aromas of early autumn apples and pears are subtly enhanced with sweet notes of vanilla and mint toffee.Palate: Exceptionally smooth and creamy, with spicy-sweet nutmeg and honey combining with the freshness of autumn fruits.Finish: Long, soft and warming.Matured in a combination of hand-selected traditional and sherry oak casks for a minimum of ten years, this expression represents the very essence of Aberlour character.As a classic Speyside malt, this ten year old Aberlour achieves a remarkable harmony marrying subtle aromas of spice with hints of autumn fruits, giving it a soft and long finish.

product.productName: The Glenlivet Single Malt Whisky 12 years old -
product.productDescription: The single malt that started it all

Light&delicate with a warming honey finish. Single malt Scotch whisky. Taste. Slumbering for a full decade in quiet contentment, this beguiling spirit has a lingering taste of sweet pear, crushed apples and maple syrup with gentle notes of honey, caramel, soft liquorice and roasted coffee beans. In a world of its own. The Isle of Jura can be found nestled off the west coast of Scotland. It's a place famed as much for its folklore as it is for its whisky. A magical haven where a sense of solitude pervades: one road, one pub, one community and one distillery. There is no whisky and no island quite like Jura. It truly is in a world of its own. The story. Origin is the whisky that begins the Jura journey. It carries the traditional Celtic symbol for birth, beginning and the forces of nature. It tells of a passion rekindled, a distillery reborn and a remarkable whisky forged by turbulent seas and windswept landscapes. Become a Diurach. Diurachs is the Gaelic name for the people of Jura. Proud of our land and our whisky, we are a small and close-knit community of fewer then 200, united by the island we love and the warmth of its people. With a dram of the good stuff in hand, we toast the health of our friends near and far. Become an honorary Diurach and join us. Life doesn't get any better. You'll even get a free dram for life every month at the Jura Pub. To find out just how good being a Diurach could be visit jurawhisky.com

product.productName: Tamdhu 10 Year Old Single Malt Whisky Speyside -
product.productDescription: The world's finest single malt scotch whisky. Aged 10 years. Matured in sherry casks. Speyside single malt Scotch whisky. Nose. The softness of vanilla and sugared almonds, balanced by fresh oak and cinnamon. Palate. Bursting with fruit and spice - gently yielding to toffee and the richness of sherry oak. Finish. Fruit and vanilla linger, becoming pleasantly drying - finally unveiling the merest wisp of peat smoke. In 1897, Tamdhu distillery was born of its founders' can-do spirit, and 200 years of Scottish Industry. Today, Tamdhu 10 year old embodies the same intrepid approach. Matured exclusively in sherry oak casks, we ensure every drop is as magnificent now as it was then. Inspired by the enlightenment and two centuries of Industry and Endeavour. A Co. of gentlemen merchants and purveyors of the 'Can-Do-Spirit'. Devised&constructed the era's most 'remarkable distillery' with the singular aim of producing

product.productName: Glengoyne 12 Year Old Single Malt Whisky Highlands -
product.productDescription: Nurtured then matured for 12 years. Natural colour from time and oak casks alone. Highland single malt scotch whisky. Lemon Zest, toffee apples - and a scent of coconut. Hand-selected sherry casks help create this paradise of flavours and rich, golden colour. It's the taste of Scotland's slowest distillation, and our insistence on barley dried by air - never peat. Up to six years from oak Forest to Highland Distillery. That is how long it takes before sherry casks are finally ready to receive our spirit. However, the journey has just begun. Time and wood work together over the next twelve years. - Within the cool darkness of our traditional, earth-floored warehouses. Here, away from sight, the rich golden hue develops, along with a light sherry finish. It is the perfect way to end. - The delicate taste of barley shines through to the last. All in Good Time. Our stills are Scotland's slowest. Unhurried, our new spirit benefits from the gentlest of journeys - developing the unique Glengoyne flavour. Patience. Stillman, Dumgoyne, Scotland. Hand-Selected Sherry Casks - The home for almost all the spirit that will become Glengoyne 12 year old. Oak Casks. Cooper, Jerez, Spain. We dry our barley by air, never peat. This unlocks the subtle, complex flavours of slow distillation and exquisite wood. Unpeated. Mashman, Dumgoyne, Scotland. Fine casks need space to breathe. We stack them just three high, in the cool darkness of our stone-built warehouse. Maturation. Warehouseman, Dumgoyne, Scotland. The rich golden hue of Glengoyne 12 year old comes from time and wood alone. Why would we add anything else? Natural Colour. Malt Master, Edinburgh, Scotland. We've been learning our trade since 1833. Why change something that took generations to perfect? Tradition. Distillery Manager, Dumgoyne, Scotland

ESTD 1830. THE ONLY SINGLE MALT SCOTCH WHISKY FROM THE ISLE OF SKYE. From the western shores of the Isle of Skye, in the tall shadows of the Cuillin Hills, comes a single malt like no other. An alluring, sweet, full-bodied spirit with a warming afterglow, so easy to enjoy yet, like Skye itself, so hard to leave. AGED 10 YEARS. CLASSIC MALTS OF SCOTLAND. Talisker, made beside the Loch Harport in the jagged shadow of the Cuillin range, is the only single malt whiskey from the Isle of Skye. A soft, smoky nose introduces an enticing, sweet taste. Full bodied and smooth, this muscular malt also has a robust, deep intensity. It has a long, richly warming finish. Founded in 1830, the distillery keeps faith with traditional values. Surviving a disastrous fire in 1960 the distillery was rebuilt around exact copies of the old pot still and worm tubs, preserving a method of distillation found nowhere else. And today Talisker is for many the complete, even the only single malt. Talisker is one of the six CLASSIC MALTS from Scotland's malt whisky making regions. They are: TALISKER\u2122·Island. GLENKINCHIE\u2122·Lowland. DALWHINNIE\u2122·Highland. CRAGGANMORE\u2122·Speyside. OBAN\u2122·West Highland. LAGAVULIN\u2122·Islay.

Single malt scotch whisky. Marrying is a dying art in Scotch Whisky making, but it ensures consistency and high quality in the spirit, and The Balvenie and Glenfiddich are two of the few distilleries left still marry their whiskies after maturation. The Belvenie Doublewood is a 12 year old single malt which gains its maturation in two woods. Unlike most distilleries, The Balvenie still uses traditional methods in the productions of their whisky. The barley used is grown by the distillery on their land, and the water used is from the pure natural springs in the Conval Hills. The Balvenie Distillery is the only Speyside Distillery to have its own floor maltings, thus reinforcing its links with traditional methods of Scotch Whisky production. The Balvenie employ their own coppersmith to tend to the stills and coopers to look after the casks, so The Balvenie employees have thw wisdom of experience when making the whisky. The Balvenie won Gold Medal in the International Wine&Spirit Competition and the International Spirit Challenge 2001. Balvenie website: www.balvenie.com

The No 1 Islay malt in the UK and globally - The only Islay malt you will need to stock. Unmistakable peat-smoke flavours - An unforgettable, challenging yet rewarding experience. A truly iconic brand - Instantly recognised around the world and with a global community of over 540,000 Friends of Laphroaig. The only single malt Scotch whisky to be awarded the Royal Warrant by HRH Prince of Wales - The Royal Crest on the distillery and on every bottle of Laphroaig is the ultimate seal of approval of the highest quality product. What Makes Laphroaig Special? The definitive Islay single malt: Peaty, smoky, challenging, rewarding. One of the most richly peated whiskies (up to 50 ppm). The high level of peat gives it its characteristic taste. Only one of a few distilleries that still uses traditional malting floors. It dries the malted barley over a peat fire made from hand cut peat from its own peat beds in Islay. This adds to the distinctive, pungent, peaty, iodine aroma. Matured exclusively in first fill bourbon casks. Warehouse location close to the sea, imparts a slightly sea salty character. Appearance. Sparkling gold. Nose. Huge smoke, seaweed, a hint of sweetness. Palate. Islay peat-smoke, full and earthy, tangy salt-laden air, an echo of sweetness at the end, unforgettable. Finish. Very long.
